bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ted Rose (1940-2002) was born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin in 1940. He began traveling to photograph railroads as a 16-year-old. Rose earned a BA from the University of Illinois in painting and printmaking. He began graduate school at Tulane University but decided to pursue an art career outside of academia.

Rose served in the US Army from 1963-1965, including a tour in Vietnam. Following his service, Rose moved to New Mexico, settling in Chama (1965) then Santa Fe (1966). He married Polly (Towers) Rose in July 1967, and together they raised two children.

Rose operated a graphic design business in Santa Fe. He received a Lifetime Achievement Award from the Northern New Mexico Advertising Federation in 2000. One of Rose's favorite projects was designing the logos and paint scheme for the Santa Fe Southern Railway in 1993.

Rose returned to watercolor painting in the 1980s. He created full-scale paintings, calendars, and illustrated books including In the Traces: Railroad Paintings of Ted Rose (2000). Rose was elected to the American Watercolor Society in 1993 and the National Watercolor Society in 1999. His watercolors have been featured in exhibitions, collections, U.S. Postal Service stamps, and three Amtrak calendars (1997-1999).
Rose passed away from cancer in 2002, at age 61. Railroad Heritage published a special edition about his life in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Ted Rose collection contains over 5,000 railroad photographs from the United States, Canada, and Mexico by American artist Ted Rose. COntents include 4,600 black-and-white negatives, over 500 black-and-white prints, and contact sheets, stemming from about 1956-1962. In addition, the colleciton contains a selection of materials documenting Rose's life and approach to art, including papers, books, articles, and optical media.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by format. This arrangement was fixed by the processing archivist.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated to the Center by Polly Rose in 2015.

list.item: The label of CSNeg# indicates that an image is scanned from a contact sheet. Some images are repeated across the collection because they are present as negatives and in contact sheets.
Rose's original metadata generally lacked dates; images were labeled by subject or location.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: In most cases the Center owns the copyright for the photographs in our collections. The Center does ask for the proper credit (see below) to recognize the photographer and the collection.
